extendedIngredients.name: plum tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 large Italian plum tomatoes, cut in half lengthwise (or 4 medium zucchini... or mixture of both)
metaInformation: cut in half lengthwise (or 4  zucchini... or mixture of both)

extendedIngredients.name: sharp cheddar cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups finely shredded sharp cheddar cheese, divided

extendedIngredients.name: shell pasta
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups tiny uncooked shell pasta (or other small pasta)

extendedIngredients.name: vegetable stock
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup Kitchen Basics® Unsalted Chicken or Vegetable Stock (or broth)

recipes.title: Macaroni and Cheese Stuffed Vegetable Boats
recipes.instructions: 1.  Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.  Spray a rimmed baking sheet or pan with nonstick spray.  2.  Fill a medium saucepan 3/4-full of water.  Add the chicken stock/broth.  Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.  Add the pasta and cook, stirring once in a while, for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the pasta is tender.  Drain and rinse the pasta- set it aside and clean out the pan.3.  While the pasta is cooking, use a small spoon to scrape out the insides of each tomato or zucchini half.  Don't scrape the vegetable all the way to the skin- just enough to make a deep pocket where you'll be able to put the macaroni stuffing.  Place the vegetables skin-side-down in the prepared pan.4.  Warm the milk in the saucepan over medium heat.  Whisk in the mustard.  Then whisk in the flour, pepper, basil and oregano.  Cook and stir for 1 minute, until thickened.  Add 1 cup of the cheese and whisk until smooth.  Stir in the cooked pasta.5.  Divide the pasta between the hollowed out vegetables, mounding as needed.  Top off the mac with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.  Sprinkle with panko.  Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.  Spray a rimmed baking sheet or pan with nonstick spray.  2.  Fill a medium saucepan 3/4-full of water.
Add the chicken stock/broth.  Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Add the pasta and cook, stirring once in a while, for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the pasta is tender.

Drain and rinse the pasta- set it aside and clean out the pan.3.  While the pasta is cooking, use a small spoon to scrape out the insides of each tomato or zucchini half.  Don't scrape the vegetable all the way to the skin- just enough to make a deep pocket where you'll be able to put the macaroni stuffing.
Place the vegetables skin-side-down in the prepared pan.4.  Warm the milk in the saucepan over medium heat.
Whisk in the mustard.  Then whisk in the flour, pepper, basil and oregano.  Cook and stir for 1 minute, until thickened.

Add 1 cup of the cheese and whisk until smooth.  Stir in the cooked pasta.5.  Divide the pasta between the hollowed out vegetables, mounding as needed.  Top off the mac with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.  Sprinkle with panko.
